Name: Manuel Antonio
Description: Costa Rica National Park in Puntarenas. Area: 16.24 km². One of Costa Rica's most photographed sites - a blend of pristine beaches and dense jungle

Name: Corcovado
Description: Costa Rica National Park in Puntarenas. Area: 424 km². One of Costa Rica's most photographed sites - pristine rainforest with incredible biodiversity and wildlife viewing opportunities

Name: Tortuguero
Description: Costa Rica National Park in Limón. Area: 312 km². One of Costa Rica's most photographed sites - unique canal system and sea turtle nesting beaches

Name: Arenal Volcano
Description: Costa Rica National Park in Alajuela. Area: 120.16 km². One of Costa Rica's most photographed sites - a perfectly conical active volcano surrounded by lush rainforest

Name: Poás Volcano
Description: Costa Rica National Park in Alajuela. Area: 65 km². One of Costa Rica's most photographed sites - features an active volcano with a massive crater and vibrant blue-green acidic lake

Name: Irazú Volcano
Description: Costa Rica National Park in Cartago. Area: 23.4 km²

Name: Braulio Carrillo
Description: Costa Rica National Park in San José. Area: 475.84 km²

Name: Cahuita
Description: Costa Rica National Park in Limón. Area: 10.67 km²

Name: Chirripó
Description: Costa Rica National Park in San José. Area: 508.49 km². One of Costa Rica's most photographed sites - highest peak in Costa Rica offering panoramic views of both Pacific and Caribbean coasts

Name: Guanacaste
Description: Costa Rica National Park in Guanacaste. Area: 340 km²

Name: Rincón de la Vieja
Description: Costa Rica National Park in Guanacaste. Area: 141.25 km². One of Costa Rica's most photographed sites - active volcano with hot springs

Name: Tapantí
Description: Costa Rica National Park in Cartago. Area: 58.32 km²

Name: Carara
Description: Costa Rica National Park in Puntarenas. Area: 52.4 km²

Name: Palo Verde
Description: Costa Rica National Park in Guanacaste. Area: 184.25 km²

Name: Ballena Marine
Description: Costa Rica National Park in Puntarenas. Area: 110.00 km². One of Costa Rica's most photographed sites - stunning beaches and whale watching opportunities

Name: Monteverde Cloud Forest Reserve
Description: One of Costa Rica's most photographed sites - a misty cloud forest with hanging bridges and rich biodiversity

Name: Río Celeste Waterfall
Description: Stunning turquoise waterfall in Tenorio Volcano National Park - one of Costa Rica's most photographed natural wonders

Name: La Fortuna Waterfall
Description: 70-meter waterfall plunging into a pool surrounded by dense jungle - popular photography destination near Arenal Volcano

Name: Tenorio Volcano
Description: Costa Rica National Park in Alajuela. Home to the famous Río Celeste Waterfall - one of Costa Rica's most photographed natural wonders
